notes: McTavish missed practice on Saturday and will be a game-time decision on Sunday (Nov. 10) vs. Columbus.
Fowler did not play in Friday's (Nov. 8) game vs. Minnesota.
Lyon is OUT for Saturday's (Nov. 9) game against New York.

Kolosov is OUT for (Nov. 9) game against Florida.

Hayes did not play in Friday's (Nov. 8) game against Washington.
Walman did not play in Thursday's (Nov. 7) game against Minnesota.

Boeser is out on Saturday (Nov. 9) vs. Edmonton and is still being evaluated.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed D Nicolas Hague on injured reserve.
Marchment will be a game-time decision on Saturday's (Nov. 9) game versus Winnipeg.
Novak is OUT on Saturday (Nov. 9) versus Utah.

Point did not play in Thursday's (Nov. 7) game versus Philadelphia.
Forbort is expected to be sidelined for weeks, possibly as long as a month, due to a knee injury, Freelance reporter Irfaan Gaffar reports.
The Philadelphia Flyers placed F Ryan Poehling on injured reserve.
The Calgary Flames placed F Anthony Mantha on injured reserve.
Peeke is week-to-week with an upper-body injury, per Daily Faceoff - Fantasy.

Bastian will be out week-to-week, Amanda Stein of the Devils' official site reports.
Broberg will be sidelined for 4-6 weeks, Jeremy Rutherford of The Athletic reports Monday.

Barzal is dealing with an upper-body injury and is OUT for 4-6 weeks.

Joseph hasn't resumed skating and remains unavailable to play, head coach Drew Bannister told Lou Korac of NHL.com.
Andersen is week-to-week after the goaltender was re-evaluated yesterday for his lower-body injury.
Colorado Avalanche's F Ross Colton is expected to miss 6-8 weeks.
Lazar underwent a successful left knee procedure. He is out indefinitely, and updates will be provided as available.

Leddy will join the Blues on their upcoming four-game road trip, which will begin Thursday (Oct. 24) in Toronto, per Lou Korac of NHL.com.
Gudbranson underwent successful shoulder surgery yesterday and is without a timetable to return.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Victor Olofsson on Injured Reserve.
The Utah Hockey Club announced D Sean Durz has undergone successful shoulder surgery and is expected to return in 4-6 months.
The Colorado Avalanche placed F Jonathan Drouin on the Injured Reserve.

Jenner underwent shoulder surgery Wednesday and could return before the end of the season, Jeff Svoboda of the Blue Jackets' official site reports.

Campbell will be away from the Red Wings for an indefinite period of time after it was announced Friday that he has entered the NHL/NHLPA Player Assistance Program.
The Toronto Maple Leafs placed F Calle Jarnkrok on the Injured Reserve.
Brindley has been placed on injured reserve and is expected to miss 4 to 6 weeks.

Grosenick underwent successful surgery to repair a torn anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee and will not play this season. He is expected to make a full recovery and be ready for the start of the 2025-26 season.
Reinbacher underwent surgery to his left knee this morning and is out 5-to-6 months.

Marino underwent successful surgery and is expected to return in 3-4 months.

Oshie will be put on long-term injured reserve due to a chronic back injury that's expected to cost him the entire 2024-25 campaign, per Tom Gulitti of NHL.com.
